Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: pastark
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de Westertoren and the small, similar hotels in the arcade on Raadhuisstraat in Amsterdam, between the Herengracht and Keizersgracht (canals), are an unsung treasure for travelers to Amsterdam. I have been staying in one or another of these hotels since 1981, and I will continue to do so every time I'm in Amsterdam. They are no-frills tourist hotels, with tasty breakfasts, comfortable beds, and can't beat location. The only down side is that most are located up a 2-story, steep staircase, which can be difficult for older or infirm travelers. These hotels are for travelers who don't want to spend money on fancy but who want to be comfortable. Several hotels advertise as gay-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Needed.”
Reviews.Author: Jessska
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked this hotel online from Australia and loved the pictures and reviews. Being a young couple backpacking Europe we were on a budget and just needed something with decent bedding and a shower. This hotel was close to the central train station (10-15 min walk or 7eur taxi ride) and had trams passing directly outside. Close to the centre town square, Anne Franks house and the most AMAZING dutch pancake restaraunt that EVERYONE must try - Sarah's Pancakes. We had the room on the top floor with a balcony. The room was typical European size (small but not uncomfortable and we even had large bags) and had a shower, TV, coffee facilities, and a really comfortable bed. Toilet was right outside our door and we got a continental breakfast delivered daily. The staff were also incredibley friendly and even helped us with tours and let us leave our bags in the office for the day when we had to check out. The only things newcomers should be prepared for is the stairs and the gorgoues cat resident (just incase your severly allergic - she doesn't come near you though). The pictures tell no lies about the stairs but you do get used to it. All the stairs are like this in the city though so it's nothing unusual. I am happy to recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: francybefy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is located near by Dam square, the centre of Amsterdam. It's well connected by tram, and offers airport shuttle service free. The room was very clean and the owner brought us breakfast in the room. The breakfast was very delicious and there was always a kettle for making coffe when you want. There is a cat who roams the rooms, it's very funny. The owners are very kind and hospitable and the Hotel is excellent value for money. Great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel, Friendly, Clean and ust GREAT!!!”
Reviews.Author: lauragaul
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly staff, yeah the stairs are high, but so is everywhere in amserdam, its in a great location, near to everything, no long walks back, I went with 6 friends, the room was so comfy and clean, The cat there is really friendly. Cheap prices and great service!! I would definatly recommend and stay again!

Reviews.Title: “disappointing room but good location”
Reviews.Author: redariel
Reviews.Content: This is at the bottom of my still stay list for A-dam. It is inexpensive but very dusty and they had to be essentially bribed to change the sheets. If I had to I would stay there again as the price is low and location perfec but I could do better for 75 Euros a night.. I got tired asking for clean sheets and the dust was very bad in the room. I routinely say I dont care much what the room is like as long as the location is good but this place is on the edge. You should try some other places in the neighborhood. It beats the Amstelzicht where I am sure the maid stole my globalphone and ran up some amazing charges.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: easytoplease61
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located. Even with a Priceline "Big Deal" It was 100 Euros. 10 rooms located at the top of an "Amsterdam staircase". En Suite. I haven't been in Amsterdam for about a year, but thought the price was too high for pretty simple digs. Do yourself a favor and stay in one of the neyghborhoods and ride the tram. Maybe they are now pricey also

Reviews.Title: “was to be expected”
Reviews.Author: misscheekychick
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for 1 night excellent position great view breakfast wat we expected friendly staff one compliant the stairs was deadly

Reviews.Title: “Great location, donÂ´t expect sleep or service”
Reviews.Author: ryansg
Reviews.Content: Hotel was overbooked (which seems like a recurring problem) and I was brought to Hotel Galery which was fortunately just a few doors away. Receptionist offered to walk me to the hotel, but did not offer to help me with suitcase down the very very steep stairs. Once at the Hotel, I was asked to pay upfront, the same rate that I would have paid Westertoren, which I did, only to find the tiny cell I was assigned to had no ensuite shower or TV that was promised by Westertoren. To compound the problem, check-out was 11am, but I could only check in at 12noon. This meant I had to disrupt my day, just to return to the hotel, re-pack, and move to the other hotel. (Note: ask to see room before paying!) When I went back to Westertoren, I was offered an upgrade. Yet, I still felt short-changed. I paid a high rate for a crap room. Then I had to waste time to manage a problem that they created. The receptionist also asked me to return in an hour to move my luggage. I told him to move it up for me since I did not intend to keep returning to the hotel in a day. When I returned at 4pm, my luggage was still out in the open - with no one to guard it, neither had it been brought into my room. I found out that my new room was not ready yet. I was asked to wait at the next room for about 15 minutes. After more than 15 minutes, they were still not done yet, and they offered me the room I was in instead. This new room was noisy - as mentioned. ItÂ´s next to a tram line and the bells are pretty, but noisy too. I had a balcony, a nice view, two beds (one double, one single), which did not help me much since I was travelling alone. (Note: I think there are rooms that do not face the main street, try and get those.) I did not get to sleep much on that one night. This was a complicated review - the place is cheap and location is convenient, but you have to weigh it against what seems to be prevalent problems that occur and whether you wish to spend half a day of your vacation trying to sort out the problems they throw at you.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LauUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, really close to all the restaurants, nightlife and attractions in the centre of Amsterdam and also the picturesque Jordaan district. All the staff we met were really friendly and helpful, giving us directions to various sights and also useful things such as the nearest cashpoint that didn't charge for international withdrawals! The room was basic but comfortable, with en suite shower and lovely balcony. Breakfast was delivered to our room every morning, which was very tasty and your typical European style breakfast. I was very impressed with the hotel considering it was just about the cheapest we could find on the web, the stairs weren't a problem for us as we only had backpacks instead of suitcases, so I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean! Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: hanbanan738
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend travelled from Scotland for a few days, and this hotel was completly up to scratch. The stairs, as others have mentioned, are lethal! I had read about the stairs but nothing can prepare you for them! Staff were friendly, breakfast was good, lovely view - even from the back window - lots of light. We were in room number 8 I think. But yeah, I'll stay again when I'm back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience with Hotel de Westertoren”
Reviews.Author: beautifulcruiser
Reviews.Content: We made a booking with Hotel de Westertoren in January for our trip in May. When we got there, they found our file but told us they made a mistake and overbooked the hotel. They sent us to another hotel that they claimed was 300 m away and was their brother hotel. We had to lug all our luggages back down their severely steep staircases without any assistance. Then we went dragged our suitcases to the location they suggested but could not find the hotel. We had to go back twice to ask the name and the exact location because they got it wrong both times. The hotel was actually 1 mile away. When we got to the new hotel, we found out that the hotel had no association with Westertoren and had never heard of them. Furthermore, we ended up having to pay more than what we had to pay with Westertoren.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: scotslassml9
Reviews.Content: booked this hotel after reading good reviews, was extremely dubious as it s one star hotel. first impresion was my goodness they were not exaggerating about steepness of steps, even by amsterdam standards. However you do get used to them but please do not book if you have mobility problems. the room was very clean but was small our room had double bed and single bed but wouldnt have liked to share with three. for us we booked for location , just at the back of dam square and round corner for ann frank house. we aslo picked this over another three star hotel because there were tea/coffee facilities in room. cleaned every day and tea/coffee replenished. staff were exteremely pleasant. all in all i would recommend this hotel if like us we are never in room (only when we arrive home early hours and crash out!!) we travel once twice every year to amsterdam but with the exchange rate found it very very expensive this time so take plenty cash.

Reviews.Title: “Small but cosy”
Reviews.Author: UnkleTomas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, and found it to be a pretty decent hotel for Amsterdam on budget. You have to walk up two straight floors of very steep steps, which is typical for Amsterdam, can be a pain with luggage. Room was small, but bed was nice and we had very large windows which was nice. Breakfast wich was brought to our room at 9am was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: TXGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed at Hotel de Westertoren the end of May '07. Amsterdam is know for its canal houses and steep stairways, but this was crazy! Once inside you will find a very steep stairway leading to the check-in office. It literally was like climbing a ladder. If you are elderly or have any trouble climbing with suitcases please keep this in mind. Once checked in you will find another flight of stairs leading to a couple rooms. It didn't end there for us, up one more flight of stairs we finally arrived at our room (Number 8). I think there were just under 80 steps. The hotel reception was very friendly and offered us a chocolate, which we later ate after we caught our breath. I would definitely ask for a room in the back. The hotel has no A/C so you need to sleep with your window open. While the rooms in the front have a balcony, it is a very busy street and quite loud. Number 8 is in the back. The room has a mini-fridge tucked away in the closet. There is a small (10"x6"x3") safe in the wall which is available to rent for a daily fee. The room is very small, but adequate if you just need somewhere to shower and sleep. The bathroom is separated from the room by an accordian folding door. There is nowhere to put your clothes while showering and the entire floor gets wet when you shower. The sink is located in the corner of the shower, so if you plan on shaving bring a mirror to hang above the sink. There was plenty of hot water. There is no phone in the room to contact the front desk. This means taking a trip down 2 flights of stairs to get another towel or whatever you need. This also means no wake-up call, so unless you are an early riser, bring an alarm clock. Breakfast is delivered to the room each morning with a knock on the door around 08:30, which acts as a good wake-up call. Breakfast consists of a juice box, 2 slices of bread, a hard-boiled egg, butter, jelly and a small yogurt or pudding. There is a "coffee maker" to heat up the water to add to some instant capacinno or tea, your choice. The hotel is in a great location though. Just a 2 minute walk to Dam Square, and about a 10 minute walk to the Anne Frank house. There is a tram stop just down the road to the left when you come out of the hotel. Be sure to get a 72 hour ticket at Central Station. It is good for all public transportation in the city and we only paid 19 Euro for one. I would stay here again if I couldn't find anything else in this location. Yes, it was small, but still adequate if you are looking for a "no frills" type hotel.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel - but overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: forzuto13
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend at the hotel for Queen's Day 2007. The prices were even more expensive for this reason that weekend. Paid 95 euro for the double, which they gave us room 9, probably the best room of hotel, since it has a little balcony, is on the top floor, has private bath and was bigger than the other rooms. The bathrooms in this place are small and ther is no place to put your things really. Luckily I had a small suitcase. They served breakfast in the room each morning around nine, so if you wanted to sleep in and also have breakfast then it wasn't possible. The beds were comfortable and with the doors closed you didn't hear so much the outside noise of the streets. The next night they moved us next door to room 8 so they could fit three people into room nine (poor guys). This room was even smaller and more cramped. There are small televisions in each room. There are also little refridgerators. All these little ammenities do not help to justify the overinflated prices, which even outside of a busy weekend were over 80 euro a night for room with private bath. Room 8 is quieter but you have no balcomy. Anyway, for the most part the rooms are clean and adequate. The hotel is in a good central location, close to the Anne Frank house (two blocks away) and the Westerkerk (one block). There is a great bagel place across the street to the right which come highly reccomended for they have fresh juice, bagel and coffee for only 4.95 euro. Mina, from Egypt, was funny and and a nice guy. He works the front desk for now. His English made me laugh and he was fun to talk to. Yes, the stairs are brutal but Mina helps you with your luggage if you need it. I wouldn't even think to stay here if you have big suitcases and more than one person in a room.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: ohio middle of woods in my teepee
Reviews.Title: “great spot”
Reviews.Author: cowboyamsterdam
Reviews.Content: this place cant be beat for the price .I just spent my 3 time there from nov 22 to dec 6 and as allways a good time was had by all. but for the stairs this is top notch hotel. from my bed I could seethe church tower that ann frank wright about.With a cosy little resturant right across the street called jennifer just right after a long day at the cannabis cup . I cant wait for next fall.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE, WITH BRUTAL STAIRS”
Reviews.Author: dave999909084
Reviews.Content: really nice rooms, only problem is stairs are sick, even for amsterdam. didn't really bvother us too much,kinda like a game to make it up, but for older folks or out of shape folks, or really clumsy, could be very dangerous. Kinda taxing just to get to the first floor. Great room. with balcony great shower,real nice

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: goodship
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, my friend and I visit Amsterdam on average twice a year. If you have stayed in the dam you probably know that many of the hotels are of a very, very poor standard. This was an exception it was clean - serviced daily. The bed was very comfortable, we had en suite facilitys with plenty of hot water (this is not always the case in Amsterdam) The location was sweet ~ in the Jordan area close to Anne Frank's which in my opinion is the best area to stay in. The breakfast is delivered to your room. One word of caution for some, it is a old tradition style building so that the stairs are very extremely steep, but if your sound on your feet this type of accommodation is far more romantic than a clinical style Best western type hotel. We are defo going to be returning visitors!

Reviews.Title: “All in all a good place”
Reviews.Author: Porcodue
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the De Westertoren 3 nights in November 2005 and for the price we spent we couldn't expect nothing better. The room was quite small for 3 people but it was clean with private bathroom. We also required the room with the balcony overlooking the main road and we got it. If you have problems to climb stairs this Hotel is not for you. The Breakfast was nothing special only bread with marmelade and boiled eggs.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de Westertoren
HotelInfo.Address: Raadhuisstraat 35b, Amsterdam 1016, The Netherlands
